tfile.h

00001 #ifndef __TFILE_H__
00002 #define __TFILE_H__
00003 
00004 #define         TFILE_OPEN                      0
00005 #define         TFILE_NOFILE            1
00006 #define         TFILE_BAD_FORMAT        2
00007 #define         TFILE_OOM                       3
00008 #define         TFILE_NOREAD            4
00009 
00010 #include <fstream>
00011 #include <cstdlib>
00012 
00013 class tfile
00014 {
00015 public:
00016         tfile(){data = 0;};
00017         ~tfile(){delete [] data;};      
00018         int load(const char* filename);
00019         short int getWidth(){return width;};
00020         short int getHeight(){return height;};
00021         GLenum getFormat(){return format;};
00022         unsigned char getType(){return type;};
00023         unsigned char getBPP(){return bpp;};
00024         unsigned char* getData(){return data;};
00025 protected:
00026         GLenum format;
00027         short int width;
00028         short int height;
00029         unsigned char type;
00030         unsigned char bpp;
00031         unsigned char* data;
00032 };
00033 
00034 int tfile::load(const char* filename)
00035 {
00036         //we are dealing with a binary file so it's easier to go this route
00037         FILE* fp;
00038         //temp files for reading and switching
00039         unsigned char tempRGB;
00040         unsigned char tempUC;
00041         unsigned short tempUS;
00042         
00043         fp = fopen(filename, "rb");
00044         
00045         if(!fp)
00046                 return TFILE_NOFILE;
00047                 
00048         //don't need first 2 bytes (id length and color map type)
00049         fread(&tempUC,sizeof(unsigned char),1,fp);
00050         fread(&tempUC,sizeof(unsigned char),1,fp);
00051         //get what type of tga it is
00052         fread(&type,sizeof(unsigned char),1,fp);
00053         //only support uncompressed RGB(A)[2] and uncompressed B&W [3]
00054         if(type != 2 && type != 3)
00055         {
00056                 fclose(fp);
00057                 return TFILE_BAD_FORMAT;
00058         }
00059         
00060         //don't need color map origin
00061         fread(&tempUS,sizeof(unsigned short),1,fp);
00062         //don't need color map length
00063         fread(&tempUS,sizeof(unsigned short),1,fp);
00064         //don't need color map entry size
00065         fread(&tempUC,sizeof(unsigned char),1,fp);
00066         //don't need origin X
00067         fread(&tempUS,sizeof(unsigned short),1,fp);
00068         //don't need origin Y
00069         fread(&tempUS,sizeof(unsigned short),1,fp);
00070         //get width, height and bits per pixel of image
00071         fread(&width,sizeof(short int),1,fp);
00072         fread(&height,sizeof(short int),1,fp);
00073         fread(&bpp,sizeof(unsigned char),1,fp);
00074         //don't need the descriptor
00075         fread(&tempUC,sizeof(unsigned char),1,fp);
00076         //set the format from the bpp
00077         if(bpp/8 == 3)
00078                 format = GL_RGB;
00079         else
00080                 format = GL_RGBA;
00081         //save some calcs by only calcing the image length in bytes once
00082         long length = width * height * (bpp/8);
00083         //resize the data dynamic array
00084         data = new unsigned char[length];
00085         
00086         //if we don't have the memory for the image array
00087         if(!data)
00088         {
00089                 fclose(fp);
00090                 return TFILE_OOM;
00091         }               
00092         //get the image data from the file
00093         fread(data,sizeof(unsigned char),length,fp);
00094         if(!data)
00095         {
00096                 fclose(fp);
00097                 return TFILE_NOREAD;
00098         }
00099         //tga stores the bytes in BGR format so now we need to switch them
00100         for(int i=0;i<length;i += (bpp/8))
00101         {
00102                 tempRGB = data[i];
00103                 data[i] = data[i+2];
00104                 data[i+2] = tempRGB;
00105         }
00106         //we are now done with the file
00107         fclose(fp);
00108         
00109         return TFILE_OPEN;
00110 }
00111 #endif
